p: A pandemic is the worldwide spread of a new disease, otherwise known as an epidemic that has spread over several countries or continents. ( Emergencies preparedness,) The world has faced several such bio-disasters including Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) in China, parts of Asia and Canada in 2003, Ebola in West Africa in 2014 and Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) in 2016. The most recent epidemic of COVID-19 led to an alarmingly high global death toll, with thousands of HCWs becoming infected ( Baud etÂ al.). The fast changing response to this novel virus was likely to have had a profound effect on the wellbeing of hospital employees working on the front-line. Furthermore, the rapid transmission rate of COVID-19 led to unparalleled tasks that HCWs may not have been adequately equipped to deal with, from both a professional and psychological viewpoint.
